question_sentence: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene has made headlines for espousing hateful conspiracy theories. What actions were taken against her this week?
choices: Removed from the House of Representatives
Censured by the Speaker of the House

question_sentence: Which of these actions would get you prioritization for a COVID-19 vaccine?
choices: Being on a weight loss program

question_sentence: Which mega-CEO announced he was stepping down from his top role?
This week, Pete Buttigieg became the first openly gay Cabinet secretary to be confirmed by the Senate.
The Chiefs and Buccaneers are squaring off at the Super Bowl on Sunday. How many Super Bowls has Tom Brady won?
A fitness video went viral this week, in which a dancer continues her aerobic routine during which distracting event?
choices: Two rats fighting over a slice of pizza in NYC

question_sentence: TikTok creators are getting record deals after their videos featuring what type of performance have gone viral?
Dustin Diamond died this week at 44. He played Screech on which iconic '90s show?
Which movie raked in the most Golden Globe nominations, announced this week?
Under a new law, which drug is decriminalized in Oregon?
Which country is reportedly top of Boris Johnson’s list of recipients for spare Covid vaccines once enough stocks have been secured for the UK’s jab campaign?
How many people in the UK are still living in flats wrapped in flammable materials despite promises of urgent action in the wake of the 2017 Grenfell Tower fire?
What is the name of the Burmese military chief who seized power in this week’s coup in Myanmar?
How many Premier League clubs would lose current sponsorship deals if a proposed ban on gambling logos on football shirts kicks in?
US doctors have pulled off the world’s first double hand and face transplant in a surgical operation that took how long?
The UK government is set to change the law to allow which cabinet minister to take maternity leave without resigning her post?
What is the name of the former president of the European Central Bank who has agreed to form a new government of national unity in Italy?
What is the name of the Asia-Pacific free trade bloc that post-Brexit Britain has applied to join?
The EU has U-turned on a threat to invoke which article of the Brexit Withdrawal Agreement that would have introduced border checks on the island of Ireland?
Elon Musk’s company Neuralink has implanted computer chips in monkeys’ brains to see if the primates can do what using only their minds?
choices: Order food on a delivery app

question_sentence: As WHO inspectors investigate the source of the coronavirus pandemic, what animal species is under scrutiny at the Wuhan Institute of Virology as a possible point of the virus’s origin?
evidence: Bats, which are known to be a major carrier of viruses, are studied at the Wuhan Insititute of Virology. Despite a lack of evidence, conspiracy theories abound that the virus responsible for Covid-19 originated at the lab.

question_sentence: Disney announced that a new television project is in the works that will take place in the “Kingdom of Wakanda.” Which superhero calls the fictional kingdom home?
evidence: Wakanda is one of the primary settings of the Black Panther franchise. The project, envisioned and led by Ryan Coogler, is part of a 5-year deal, but no other details were made available.

question_sentence: Captain Tom Moore, a 100-year-old WWII veteran and universally adored icon for fundraising millions to assist with pandemic response, died this week of Covid-19. Where did he live?
evidence: Captain Sir Tom Moore died of coronavirus complications in the UK. Moore raised millions of British pounds last year for the NHS in efforts to combat the coronavirus pandemic, earning him knighthood from the Queen among other accolades.

question_sentence: Former presidential candidate Pete Buttigieg was sworn in as Cabinet secretary of what federal agency?
evidence: Pete Buttigieg was sworn in as Secretary of Transportation, making him the first Senate-confirmed openly gay Cabinet secretary in history.

question_sentence: What will the Proud Boys soon be considered in Canada?
evidence: The group will be designated as an extremist terrorist entity “fueled by white supremacy, anti-Semitism, racism, homophobia, Islamophobia and misogyny,” according to Canadian Public Safety Minister Bill Blair. Officials claim the move will assist in freezing financial assets, criminalize financing, and recruitment.

question_sentence: Andy Jassy will soon taking over as CEO for which company?
evidence: It was announced that Andy Jassy, currently CEO of Amazon Web Services, will be taking over as Amazon’s CEO, replacing founder Jeff Bezos later this year. Bezos will be transitioning to the role of executive chair.

question_sentence: Which consulting firm is paying $537 million in a multistate settlement for its role in promoting and profiting from the opioid crisis in the United States?
evidence: McKinsey & Company will be paying out the settlement in an agreement reached with a coalition of 47 attorneys general, the District of Columbia and five US territories.

question_sentence: The United States and which other country agreed to extend the New START Treaty for an additional five years?
evidence: Secretary of State Anthony Blinken announced that the United States and Russia have extended the New START treaty, a key nuclear arms control agreement that was set to expire on February 5th.

question_sentence: Voting technology company Smartmatic has filed a $2.7 billion lawsuit against individuals for their role in a “disinformation campaign” against the company during the 2020 US presidential election. Who is named in the lawsuit?
evidence: Pro-Trump attorneys Rudy Giuliani and Sidney Powell, as well as Fox News hosts Jeanine Pirro, Lou Dobbs and Maria Bartiromo are all part of the lawsuit. Fox News itself is also being sued, with Smartmatic citing a projected loss of hundreds of millions of dollars worth of profit and a globally damaged reputation.

question_sentence: Angelina Jolie’s is selling the only piece of artwork this famous man painted during World War II. Who is the artist?
evidence: Winston Churchill is the artist behind “Tower of the Koutoubia Mosque,” the only painting the former British prime minister composed during World War II. Churchill gave the painting to then US President Franklin D. Roosevelt during the Casablanca Conference in January 1943.
